metadata.description: Execution order for slash commands in the Linux Desktop ClaudeMD Seeder workflow
metadata.purpose: Defines the systematic process for spawning CLAUDE.md files across the user's filesystem
metadata.note: These commands should be run in sequence to ensure proper context gathering before file generation

execution_order.purpose: Depersonalize template CLAUDE.md files by replacing author references with user-specific or generic references
outputs: Modified CLAUDE.md templates with user-specific or generic references

execution_order.purpose: Capture the user's Linux distribution, variant, DE, and display server (X11/Wayland)
Discover existing CLAUDE.md files outside repository bases and record them to prevent duplicate installations
Probe the filesystem by capturing directory maps of root (/) and home (~) directories
Interview the user to identify the purpose of paths on their filesystem
Match template CLAUDE.md files to corresponding paths on the user's filesystem
Create custom path mappings for unique user directories that don't match standard templates
Install CLAUDE.md files to the matched paths on the user's filesystem while respecting existing files
outputs: CLAUDE.md files deployed across the user's filesystem

notes: The run-slashes.md command is a meta-command that executes this sequence automatically
Each command builds upon context gathered by previous commands
Users can run individual commands for maintenance/updates after initial setup
The workflow is designed to be repeatable - later runs may only update existing files
